paper_title.en: Utilization of stereo disparity and optical flow information for the computer analysis of human interactions

description.en: We propose a system that simultaneously utilizes the stereo disparity and optical flow information of real-time stereo grayscale multiresolution images for the recognition of objects and gestures in human interactions. For real-time calculation of the disparity and optical flow information of a stereo image, the system first creates pyramid images using a Gaussian filter. The system then determines the disparity and optical flow of a low-density image and extracts attention regions in a high-density image. The three foremost regions are recognized using higher-order local autocorrelation features and linear discriminant analysis. As the recognition method is view based, the system can process the face and hand recognitions simultaneously in real time. The recognition features are independent of parallel translations, so the system can use unstable extractions from stereo depth information. We demonstrate that the system can discriminate the users, monitor the basic movements of the user, smoothly learn an object presented by users, and can communicate with users by hand signs learned in advance.

paper_title.en: Development of head gesture interface for electric wheelchair

description.en: For persons with severe disabilities who find it difficult to use the joystick of an electric wheelchair, we have developed an interface that enables an electric wheelchair to be operated by gestures such as head movements. By using a camera for visual sensing, we plan to implement a non-contact non-constraining interface, thereby making the interface much more convenient to use. We are keeping this study user-oriented by conducting clinical tests with the help of actual users to determine where the camera should be situated, how it should be used, and so on. © ACM 2007.

paper_title.ja: 依田 育士，細谷 大輔，坂上 勝彦：ユビキタスステレオビジョンによる駅ホーム端安全管理
paper_title.en: Ubiquitous Stereo Vision for Controlling Safety on Platforms in Railroad Station

description.en: Dozens of people are killed every year when they fall off of train platforms, making this an urgent issue to be addressed by the railroads, especially in the major cities. This concern prompted the present work that is now in progress to develop a Ubiquitous Stereo Vision based system for safety management at the edge of rail station platforms. In this approach, a series of stereo cameras are installed in a row on the ceiling that are pointed downward at the edge of the platform to monitor the disposition of people waiting for the train. The purpose of the system is to determine automatically and in real-time whether anyone or anything is in the danger zone at the very edge of the platform, whether anyone has actually fallen off the platform, or whether there is any sign of these things happening. The system could be configured to automatically switch over to a surveillance monitor or automatically connect to an emergency brake system in the event of trouble. © 2004, The Institute of Electrical Engineers of Japan. All rights reserved.

publication_name.en: IEEJ Transactions on Electronics, Information and Systems

paper_title.en: Ubiquitous Stereo Vision for Controlling Safety on Platforms in Railroad Station

description.en: Dozens of people are killed every year when they fall off of train platforms, making this an urgent issue to be addressed by the railroads, especially in the major cities. paper_title.ja: ステレオ距離情報による腕さしジェスチャインタフェース
paper_title.en: Arm Pointing Gesture Interface by Surrounded Stereo Cameras System

description.ja: ステレオ距離情報を利用した腕さしジェスチャインタフェースを提案する.ステレオカメラを利用することで利用者の服装や照明条件に対し頑健な距離情報を非接触,非拘束に取得する.そしてこの情報を利用し,複数利用者に対して腕さし認識を行う.さらに利用者の空間内の位置,進行方向,立位と座位の姿勢も同時に利用する.本論文では室内天井四隅にステレオカメラを設置した環境に対して本手法を実装し,複数の照明環境下で多地点での腕さし認識評価実験を行った.さらに実際のアプリケーション例として腕さしジェスチャインタフェースによるBluetoothを用いた家電製品制御を実装した.ここでは腕さし方向の特定手法と利用者の意図しない腕さし認識の抑制手法,及び実験結果について述べる.
description.en: We proposed an arm pointing gesture interface using surrounded stereo cameras. This method could recognize multi person's intentional arm pointing gesture independently. Stereo camera provides depth information maps in real-time and the result is robust to lighting changes and user's wearing. Utilizing this feature, we developed sensing arm pointing method and ignoring method of unconscious arm pointing gesture. This interface does not depend on the user's position, direction and posture. We set four stereo cameras on four top corners of ceiling and applied this method in various lighting environments. We evaluated five user's arm pointing in multi points and obtained reliable accuracy. Furthermore, we applied this method to arm pointing gesture interface for home electronics using Bluetooth.

publisher.ja: 一般社団法人電子情報通信学会
publisher.en: The Institute of Electronics, Information and Communication Engineers

publication_name.ja: 電子情報通信学会技術研究報告. HIP, ヒューマン情報処理

paper_title.ja: 多地点ステレオ距離情報による人の認識と表現手法の提案
paper_title.en: Human Sensing by Multi-points Stereo Cameras

description.ja: ステレオカメラを多地点に配置し,複数の人の存在,その個人識別,意図したジェスチャのリアルタイム認識技術に関する研究を行っている.本論文では得られた距離情報を基に,その人の基本姿勢などを認識するための段違い引き出し法を提案する.これは3次元情報を地平面と平行な複数平面に等間隔で射影するものである.その際,空間を等間隔に区切って射影するとその境界面での情報が失われるため,境界面が交差するように空間を区切って射影を行う.人を中心的な対象とし,射影された画像群から人を表現するベクトルを取得する方法について述べる.
description.en: We carried out experiments on real-time recognition technology mainly for use with humans (i.e., human existence, face recognition, and hand gestures) in real-world environments. We focused on the detection methods for the basic postures and arm pointing gestures of multiple people in the room. We placed the stereo cameras statically, utilizing range information as a key. We first project the 3D points onto many planes parallel to the floor surface. Because information from the boundaries between planes would be lost otherwise, the 3D points are projected onto overlapping planes. We call this method "cross hierarchy." Here we describe human sensing method by using range information and human expression method as vectors.

paper_title.ja: SOMによる顔画像自動分類と顔認識への利用
paper_title.en: Automatic Face Classification by Self-organization for Face Recognition

description.ja: ユーザの位置・姿勢によって顔向きの変化する室内空間全域を対象とし,顔認識を行う手法を提案する.ここでは,理想的な環境で顔向きごとに得られた画像を学習に用いるのではなく,実際に室内を自由に動き回りながら得られる多様な画像を使って学習を行う.これらの画像に対し,SOMを用いて顔向きごとの分類を行い,認識に有利な正面顔のみを自動的に選んで識別器の作成を行った.実験では,SOMによって顔向きごとに画像が分類可能であること,分類により識別器の性能が改善されることを示した.
description.en: We propose a face recognition method that can consistently identify facial features in open spaces without constraints. We firstly obtain many face images in experimental environment (4.5mx3.6m). We automatically classify the face images by self-organization, and create a discrimination circuit using only the best face images for the recognition. We showed that the recognition rate was improved by automatic classification.

The system then determines the disparity and optical flow of a low-density image and extracts attention regions in a high-density image. As the recognition method is view based, the system can process the face and hand recognitions simultaneously in real time.
